p: The clinical presentation of MERS may also be non-specific. Runny nose, sore throat, low-grade fever and myalgia can present before the viremia becomes detectable [ 4, 11]. In case of severe disease, progression to acute respiratory distress may occur. Extrapulmonary manifestations including gastrointestinal symptoms and acute kidney failure have been reported in case of severe illness, as well as neurological manifestations [ 11].
